Name: In the Light of Science: Our Ancient Quest for Knowledge and the Measure of Modern Physics

ReviewList.Text: This is a must read for everyone interested in science or philosophy. Nicolaides traces the birth of science in ancient Greece and describes it in easy to understand language. He explains how it developed through observation, reasoning and deduction. He provides excellent analysis of the scientific theories and philosophies and compares them with modern science and theories. Have you heard of the theory of everything in the news or  modern science? When you read the book, you will find out that it is an ancient concept. Great book for the casual readers, students, and teachers who may want to use it as text.

I enjoyed this book. Most other books on the history of science that I’ve read look at ancient history in the context of what was known then. In this book, author Demetris Nicolaides looks at ancient science in the light of what we know now. He draws connections between ancient and modern thinking on relativity and quantum mechanics. Actually, his explanations of both these areas are good. It makes for interesting reading but sometimes the book gets bogged down in excess philosophy. Nonetheless I recommend this book for anyone interested in the history of science.
This book is a must read!! Not only is it thought provoking, it is also an enlightening experience! Dr. Nicolaides has made a serious impact on the subject of Science.
Great book with lots of detailed information. Good for scientists and non-scientists alike.
Fun, engaging and enlightening. This is a must-read book.
